documents.document: @lyndonhood I suppose we should allow for those with less taste than us. :)

Some people seem ultra-scared of learning another language. Seems senseless not to learn our own. https://t.co/OUmx8aY0Z4
@awkward_orchid Ditto. Constant fighting is still needed. The young ’uns are way better but we’ve a long way to go.
@annegalloway @farmgeek I would love to have had it growing up.
@awkward_orchid Seems to be a lot of it on our airwaves …
@awkward_orchid Whitemansplaining.
@Jaydeear @NoorAjaj Too right!

At this rate, Bitcoin and RMB are looking better and better. https://t.co/qIKdEwuvYU
Watch the entire thing—I guess if you don’t speak in standard American English, it’s ‘Get out of my country.’ Sign… https://t.co/J86FNRexcJ
The first time I heard, ‘The future’s bright, the future’s Orange,’ it was a great slogan. Now that the orange future’s here, I’m not sure.
That’s odd, I thought #summer was grey skies and rain. What’s that bright thingy up in the sky?
Adam Curtis on our unreal world. And I realize it’s ironic to post this on social media. https://t.co/n9rwooS3B3
@jaklumen @bryanbrtltt Just thought it was a nice slice of history.
Looking at the TV footage, it appears Malcolm Turnbull has larger hands than Donald Trump.
@ANZ_NZ Cheers, thank you for that.
@retroRechercher Good typography can win elections. I might be the exception to this rule.
Thinking of my friend @timkitchin. Hope you have a great send-off today, mate.
RT @Lucire: Documentary series coinciding with Christian Dior’s 70th anniversary starting on More4 from February 9 https://t.co/gMfVIjkUPc
@ANZ_NZ Really good service from your Kilbirnie branch this morning. Young people are awesome these days.
Interesting that the National Party has adopted @rcleos’s Gilroy typeface—though some of their materials already do not match, on day one.
@happyfishmedia Franklin Gothic or a variant thereof usually works in general elections.
@happyfishmedia I am usually right based on typographic analyses but the last few National victories have been anomalies.
@seekom It’s good that the Font Police messages have been reaching citizens.
@happyfishmedia I haven’t asked him yet and he’s usually more clued up about the US ones.
The last times the National Party used a geometric typeface in their logotype and election materials: 1984 and 1987.
@wshepherd Yes, it’s made it to the headlines here, too.
The Chinese have a good way of dealing with shit parking. #YPLAC https://t.co/CrVNvzOfPI
The Trump speech generator. https://t.co/cbVWMa2byz
@jgmccl I’m wondering why people still use Facebook.
@SplaceIO No worries, just DMed you now. :)
@SplaceIO Might still be all right—for a mate; they’ve done without their guy for a couple of months so another couple of weeks might be OK.
@geeknz Thanks, I’ll DM you.
@SplaceIO Exactly. I’m on the hunt for someone here. I’ve been bombarded by emails and Tweets from bloody outsourcing firms who can’t read.
@LewisHoldenNZ Aw crap.
Only one person responded to my Tweet offering a full-time job properly. We are not outsourcing this. Repeat, we are not outsourcing this.
@owebdevelopment I requested someone domestically who would like a full-time job at an office here.
@wyoung1409 They must think we are absolutely stupid and unaware of the utterances of their leader.
@wyoung1409 The irony is New Zealand First places ads on Canto radio in Auckland urging us to vote for them because they have a Chinese MP.
@wyoung1409 You’re absolutely right. In 2014 this was my response: https://t.co/05mJgu9PoF
@owebdevelopment Who foots the bill for the 9,000 mile flight to my office for that in-person meeting?
@woodmacy036 Macy, I requested someone based domestically.
@Mind_MIPl Ailsa, I requested someone based domestically.
@tonyzeoli @rycaut @wpmudev Cool, thanks, Tony.
Summer has now been deleted. The correct term for the current season is 'autumn'.
@rycaut @tonyzeoli Thank you, I really appreciate it. You never know, we could need Tony's help for something else.
Election date announced. Any bets on how lame Winston Peters' first racist Asian joke will be? #old #rerun #establishment
@rycaut @tonyzeoli Thanks, Shannon, but I’m looking for someone who is based here and in the same time zone.
@kumararepublic @zerohedge Very accurate!
Any of my contacts really good on Wordpress, knows how to deal with servers, and after a full-time job?
@Ian56789 Thanks, Ian. I’ve shared this but due to the character limit was unable to give you credit for bringing it to my attention.

If we’re serious about bans based on the origin of terrorists, the Pulse gunman was from NY. Like Trump. Let’s stop NYers from entering.
@happyfishmedia Happy birthday!
US killer immigrants? Ft Hood murderer: born in Arlington, Va. San Bernardino murderer: Chicago, Ill. Orlando Pulse nightclub murderer: NYC.
@Baobab68 @zoho @zohocares Mine, too, just came back. Thanks for letting me know.
@zoho @zohocares Have you an estimated time for resolution? This is not the first time there has been a glitch since the start of 2017. :(
@cobraeleven_11 I am very honoured! I also run the largest Cobra 11 Facebook group—a big fan of your work over the years. :)
@cobraeleven_11 Welcome to Twitter, Erdoğan! From a fan in New Zealand.
Well, that was completely crap compared to the BBC original. https://t.co/nQzCnr5WP1
Got an OHMS letter from Companies’ House. Very surprised to learn the address is in ‘Caridff’. I know Welsh spellings are tricky, but …
Back from a seven-course dinner on the Silver Whisper. Life can be tough but someone has to do this job. @Lucire
Came across this when reading about the US remake of State of Play. Had no idea they redid Prime Suspect. Good lord. https://t.co/S3HhL3gIxj
Finished State of Play again tonight—hadn’t seen it for several years. John Simm is great; David Morrissey plays creepy well.
The nuclear threat is higher today, says Mikhail Gorbachev. https://t.co/H1GxCjUo84
Finally, a summer’s day that looks correct. #raumati #whanganuiatara https://t.co/mOhDI9VEnL
Mary Tyler Moore, Mike Connors and John Hurt all in the same week. My childhood is getting deleted.
@hariata You’re welcome. :)
@jaklumen Yes, and it is the new moon today.
@MikkiP777 Correct, in Chinese the gender isn’t specified.
Farewell, John Hurt. RIP. Best cameo ever: https://t.co/4PPYz5uiyY
A sunny summer’s day—hence why we should celebrate this New Year and not the Pope Gregory Arbitrary Year Commencement Day. 😀
We always referred to it as 雞年, not 雞公年. In Chinese culture, it’s actually the year of the non-gender-specific barnyard fowl.
Remembering Mike Connors with this great theme (and this is really a music video). https://t.co/TEZWFX8OzE

Well, he certainly looks like the sort of dickhead toff who would have little regard for others when parking. #YPLAC https://t.co/wpLbkjxRyg
I was just listening to Lalo Schifrin’s theme from Mannix yesterday. Now I hear Mike Connors has passed away. :(
新年快樂! Happy New Year!
@wshepherd I think only the Hindis can say they’ve been celebrating New Year on their day longer than we have. Have a happy New Year, Bill.
Hoping that’s the last one of this (lunar) year. #eqnz
